comment: I used 2nd method to solve this

From GATE point of view this question can be solved orally, as only the single option is going to be correct, the option with the biggest subnet mask has to be correct as if the subnet smaller than it gets invalid then the next one will automatically be invalid, but two options are not possible, hence only D can be the correct option.

Thank you so much for this course which is very useful. For Clarification about the second option 225.225.225.128,  Subnetts noted in the video as, 10.105.1.0 - 10.105.1.127 10.105.1.128 - 10.105.1.255 10.105.2.0 - 10.105.2.127 10.105.2.128 - 10.105.2.255  But, since its subnet mask's 3 octet shows as 255.255.255.128 With a /25 subnet mask,  so we can't change the 3rd octet value. Here we can use two networks only (2^1=2) 10.105.1.0 - 10.105.1.127 and 10.105.1.128 - 10.105.1.255, not 10.105.2.0 - 10.105.2.127 and 10.105.2.128 - 10.105.2.255. Is this correct?

Answer to your request : When we perform AND operation between IP address 10-105-1-113 and 255-255-255-224 result is 10-105-1-96 and When we perform AND operation between IP address 10-105-1-91 and 255-255-255-224 result is 10-105-1-64 so 10-105-1-96 and 10-105-1-64 are different networks so D is correct answer.
Sir i have made  the certified course of NETWORKING,SERVERS AND CCNA  what should i do now as i want to build career in above field?
If only this video was released 5 years ago 😢
Thank you for breaking it all down
